thread.title: What's next for Texas Rangers infielder Jurickson Profar
thread.title_full: What's next for Texas Rangers infielder Jurickson Profar | Dallas Morning News

author: Gerry Fraley
title: What's next for Texas Rangers infielder Jurickson Profar
text:
Oft-injured infielder Jurickson Profar will have his troublesome right shoulder examined in the next week. If team medical director Dr. Keith Meister clears Profar, he will participate in the Arizona Fall League as a designated hitter.
Profar could pick up the pace of a throwing program after the AFL season but will not play in a winter league. Profar has not played the field in two years because of a torn muscle in the right shoulder. He had 43 minor league at-bats as a DH this season.
The Rangers discussed Profar's future during a staff meeting, Daniels said. If Profar gets back to full health, the Rangers will have to decide if he can be a multipositional player on the major league club or needs to play regularly in the minors.
"We have to get him healthy first," Daniels said.
Briefly: Daniels and Banister will talk to 2B Rougned Odor about the virtue of rest vs. playing in the Venezuela winter league. Odor appeared in 32 games with Magallanes last season and followed that with 155 games in the majors and minors. ... Daniels has had no contact with OF Leonys Martin, who balked at the club's request that he work out with the Arizona Instructional League team to be ready if he were needed during the playoffs. Daniels indicated OF Ryan Rua passed on an assignment to the Arizona Fall League because of an approaching wedding. ... RHP Sam Wolff pitched for the first time since September 9, 2014, with a four-inning start in the Arizona Fall League. Wolff missed the minor league season because of a torn Achilles tendon.
